en.purpose: To evaluate trunk stability and mobility in patients with neurological deficits.
en.use:
The Trunk Impairment Scale score is calculated based on evaluation of 3 areas: static balance, dynamic balance and coordination. Each of these 3 areas are evaluated based on certain components. The total score ranges from 0-23. Healthy individuals should achieve a perfect score of 23. The scores for the 3 areas range as follows:

Static balance: 0 - 7; evaluated with 3 components

Dynamic balance: 0 - 10; evaluated with 10 components

Coordination: 0 - 6; evaluated with 4 components

The Trunk Impairment Scale has been shown to exhibit sufficient reliability, internal consistency and validity for use in clinical practice and research. It is mainly used to assess and quantify the trunk stability and mobility in patients who may have certain neurological deficits.
en.misuse: The TIS score mainly evaluates the sitting balance and coordination of patients. It should not be used to draw insights about the patient's standing or movement balance.

other_details.en: Trunk impairment scale calculation helps to assess the balance and coordination of patients.
other_details.references: Verheyden, G, Mertin, J, Preger, et al.  (2004). The Trunk Impairment Scale: A new tool to measure motor impairment of the trunk after stroke. Clinical Rehabilitation, 18, 326–334.

gt0035.description: This rule calculates the total score for TIS.

gt0001.description: Trunk Impairment Scale (TIS) evaluates trunk mobility and stability in patients with neurological deficits.

gt0003.description: Starting position is the patient sitting at the edge of the bed or chair without arm ad back support. The further components of the scale can be administered only if the patient can maintain this position for 10 seconds.

gt0004.description: Therapist initiates this action in which the unaffected leg, that is the side of the body that is not affected by the hemiplegia, is crossed over and placed on the hemiplegic side.

gt0005.description: Patient initiates this action in which the unaffected leg, that is the side of the body that is not affected by the hemiplegia, is crossed over and placed on the hemiplegic side.

gt0006.description: Patient touches bed or table with hemiplegic elbow (shortens hemiplegic side and lengthens unaffected side) and returns to starting position.

gt0009.description: Patient touches the bed or table with unaffected elbow (shortens unaffected side and lengthens hemiplegic side) and returns to starting position.

gt0012.description: Lifts pelvis from bed or table at hemiplegic side (shortens hemiplegic side and lengthens unaffected side) and returns to starting position.

gt0014.description: Lifts pelvis from bed or table at unaffected side (shortens unaffected side and lengthens hemiplegic side) and returns to starting position.

gt0016.description: Rotates upper trunk 6x (each shoulder moved forward 3x), hemiplegic side must move first, head fixated in starting position.

gt0018.description: Rotate lower trunk 6x (each knee moved forward 3x), hemiplegic side must move first, upper trunk fixated in starting position

gt0021.description: The individual scores of components of the TIS that assess static balance are added to give this score.

gt0022.description: The individual scores of components of the TIS that assess dynamic balance are added to give this score.

gt0023.description: The individual scores of components of the TIS that assess coordination are added to give this score.

gt0024.description: Addition of static balance score, dynamic balance score and coordination score.
